1604024 THE LEVY SUGAR PRICE EQUALISATION FUND ACT, 1976
ACT NO. 31 OF 1976 [ 16th February, 1976.]
An Act to provide for the establishment, in the interest of the general public,' of a fund to ensure that the price of levy sugar may be uniform throughout India and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Twenty- seventh Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
41630 1 Short title, extent and commencement.
237830 1This Act may be called the Levy Sugar Price Equalisation Fund Act, 1976.
1645214 2It extends to the whole of India except the State of Jammu and Kashmir.
765616 3It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.
1013397 2 Definitions. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,-
1918391 a" controlled price" means the price of the relevant grade of levy sugar, determined from time to time under sub- section (3C) of section 3 of. the Essential Commodities Act, 1955, (10 of 1955.) or under the Defence and Internal Security of India Rules, 1971, in relation to any year of production;
1750088 b" excess realisation", in relation to each grade of levy sugar,-
615652 imeans the price realised by any producer, on the sale of levy sugar of such grade, in excess of-
329276 athe controlled price, or
182 999999 1. 1- 4- 1976: Vide Notifn. No. G. S. R. 251 (E), dt. 25- 3- 1976).
107631 bwhere any fair price has been fixed by a court for levy sugar of such grade, such fair price, and
1734313 iiincludes any realisation representing the difference between the controlled price and the price allowed by the court by an interim order, if such interim order is set aside, whether by the court which made the order or in appeal or revision; 1 Explanation.- For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that where in relation to levy sugar of any grade sold by any producer, the producer has realised towards duties of excise with respect to such sugar any amount in excess of the amount payable by way of such duties, such excess shall also be deemed to be excess realisation within, meaning of this, clause;
621261 c" fair price", in relation to levy sugar, means the price fixed by the court in excess of the controlled price, and, where an interim price, fixed by the court, is superseded by a price which is finally fixed by the court, the price so finally fixed;
321563 d" Fund" means the Levy Sugar Price Equalisation Fund, established under section 3;
1218246 e1" levy sugar" means the sugar requisitioned by the Central Government under clause (f) of sub- section (2) of section 3 of the Essential Commodities Act, 1955;
1552864 f" prescribed" means prescribed by rules made under this Act;
1099663 g" producer" means a person carrying on the business of manufacturing sugar by the vacuum pan process.
953897 3 Levy Sugar Price Equalisation Fund.
1473785 1There shall be established a Fund, to be called the Levy Sugar Price Equalisation Fund.
1303880 2Save as otherwise 2 provided in sub- section (5)] there shall be credited to the Fund, in such manner as may be prescribed,-
1437337 athe amounts representing all excess realisations made by the producers, irrespective of whether such excess realisations were made before or after the commencement of this Act;
1345461 bthe amounts representing any loans which may be advanced, or grants which may be made, by the Central Government for carrying out the objects of the Fund.
961213 3Save as otherwise 2 provided in sub- section (5)] every producer shall,-
861731 ain the case of an excess realisation made before the commencement of this Act, within thirty days from such commencement,
1255099 bin the case of an excess realisation made after such commencement, within thirty days from the date on which such excess realisation was made, credit to the Fund, the amount representing such excess realisations, together with interest due thereon at the rate of twelve and a half per cent. per annum, from the date on which such amount was realised by him;
2 Provided that--
861731 athe interest due on so much of any amount of any excess realisation made before the date of commencement of the Levy Sugar Price Equalisation Fund (Amendment) Act, 1984, as is not credited to the Fund together with interest at the aforesaid rate of twelve and a half per cent. per annum before the expiry of, sixty days from the date of such commencement; and
1255099 bthe interest due on so much of the amount of any excess realisation made on or after the date of such commencement as is not credited to the Fund together with interest at the aforesaid rate of twelve and a half per cent. per annum within sixty days from the date on which such amount was realised, shall be at the rate of fifteen per cent. per annum from the date on which such amount was realised by the producer];
